episode_title: 201 - The One With Ross’ New Girlfriend

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is recapping last season, and as she talks we see a montague of scenes from Ross and Rachel.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, so this is pretty much what’s happened so far. Ross was in love with Rachel since, you know, forever, but every time he tried to tell her, something kind of got in the way, like cats, and Italian guys. Finally Chandler was like “forget about her” but when Ross was in China on his dig, Chandler let it slip that Ross was in love with Rachel. She was like, “Oh my god.” So she went to the airport to meet him when he came back, but what she didn’t know was, that Ross was getting off the plane with another woman. Uh-Oh! So, that’s pretty much everything you need to know. But, enough about us. So, how’ve you been?

content.description: [Scene, The Airport, continued from last season, Rachel is waiting for Ross to come of the plane, when she sees he’s coming off with another woman.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my god. Oh my god. (She decides to make a break for it.) Excuse me. Move! Move! Emergency! Excuse me! (She tries climbing over a bench and falls down.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, there you are! Hi! Oh, so, so, how was China, you? (Hits him with the flowers.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was, it was great. Oh, what happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re bleeding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am? Oh, look at that, yes I am. Enough about me, enough about me, Mr. Back from the Orient. Come on. I wanna hear everything! Everything. (Looks at Julie)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, where do I start? This is Julie. Julie, this is Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: These are, these aren’t for you. (to Julie) These are for you. (Loudly, thinking she can’t speak English.) Welcome to our country.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Thank you. I’m from New York.
content.parenthetical: Loudly, proving she can speak English.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, well, not a problem. We’ll just use them to stop the bleeding. Ok. Baggage claim? Ok.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang is waiting for Rachel to return from the airport with Ross.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No way!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m telling you, she went to the airport, and she’s gonna go for it with Ross!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my god. This is huge. This is bigger than huge. This is like, all right, what’s bigger than huge?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Um, this?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys, you got your hair cut.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes, we did, thanks to Vidal Buffay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ’Cause, you know, (in that voice) if you don’t look good, we don’t look good. I love that voice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Airport, airport. Ross, not alone, Julie, arm around her. Cramp, cramp.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, I think she’s trying to tell us something. Quick, get the verbs.
(She hits Chandler.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You, you, you said he liked me. (Ross and Julie enter) You, you slowpokes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s all right, Rach, we got the bags. Hi, hello. Julie, this is my sister Monica. This is Chandler. Phoebe. Joey, what up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What up?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Everyone, this is Julie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Julie.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh. (Happily) Hi!

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Hi, but I’m not here, you haven’t met me. I’ll make a much better first impression tomorrow when I don’t have 20 hours of cab and plane on me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And bus.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Oh my god.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The screaming guy?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: And the spitting?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You gotta hear this story.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: We’re on this bus, that’s easily 200 years old…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 200 at least.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: …and this guy…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And the chicken pooped in her lap. Oh, I’m so sorry. I just gave away the ending, didn’t I? Oh! It’s just, I just heard this story in the cab, and it is all I can think about.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is amazing. I mean, how, how did this happen?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Well, Ross and I were in grad school together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But we haven’t seen each other since then. Well I land in China, guess who’s in charge of the dig.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Julie! Julie, isn’t that great? I mean, isn’t that just kick-you-in-the-crotch, spit-on-your-neck fantastic?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s an expression.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, we just wanted to say a quick hi, and then we’re gonna go see the baby.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: And then we’ve gotta get some sleep.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it’s really 6:00 tomorrow night our time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, listen, don’t tell us what’s gonna happen though, ’cause I like to be surprised.
(Ross and Julie exit)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye. (She closes the door and everyone tries to sympathize with her.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler enter.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Rach, can I get some coffee?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, sure.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Rach, can I get…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did you talk to him?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not yet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Then, no.
(He goes to sit down next to Ross.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what the hell happened to you in China? I mean, when last we left you, you were totally in love with, you know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, I know I was, but there was always this little voice inside that kept saying it’s never gonna happen, move on. You know whose voice that was?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: God?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was you, pal.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, maybe it was God, doing me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, you were right. She looks at me and sees a friend, that’s all. But then I met Julie, and I don’t know, we’re havin’ a great time. And I have to say, I never would’ve gone for it with her if it hadn’t been for you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you owe me one, big guy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here’s your lemonade.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I didn’t order lemonade.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Well then, you better go take that back because they’re gonna charge you for that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Go-go-go-go, come on! (Ross goes over to the counte) (to Chandler) So uh, what did you find out?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He said…he said, he said that they’re having a great time. I’m sorry. But, the silver lining, if you wanna see it, is that he made the decision all by himself! Without any outside help whatsoever.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How is that the silver lining?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You have to really wanna see it.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and the gang is watching Sumo wrestling on TV.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ironically, these are the guys who were picked last in gym.
[Cut to Phoebe and Monica in the kitchen.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pheebes, you know what I’m thinking?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, ok. How, it’s been so long since you’ve had sex, you’re wondering if they’ve changed it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, although now that’s what I’m thinking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, so what were you thinking?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I was thinking, that you gave the guys such great haircuts, I thought, maybe you’d like to do mine?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because, I’m just, I’m incredibly anal and an unbelievable control freak.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No you’re not.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know I’m not, but you are, and I was trying to spare your feelings.
(The phone rings.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello? Oh, hi. Yeah, hold on a second. Ross, it’s Julie, for you. (Throws him the phone.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello? Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi. Anybody know a good tailor?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Needs some clothes altered?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, I’m just looking for a man to draw on me with chalk.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why don’t you go see Frankie? My family’s been goin’ to him forever. He did my first suit when I was 15. No wait, 16. No, ’scuse me, 15. (still confused) All right, when was 1990?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. You have to stop the Q-tip when there’s resistance!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, ok, sweetheart, I’ll see you later. Ok, bye. What? (Sits down next to Rachel) Oh, that is so sweet. No, no, ok, you hang up. Ok, ok, one, two, three. (Doesn’t hang up and motions for Rachel to be quiet) Well you didn’t hang up either.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She didn’t hang up either!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, no, no, you hang up. You, you, y…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sorry, I thought you were talking to me.
content.parenthetical: taking the phone and hanging it up

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel! I’ll just call her back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi? Sorry, we got disconnected… (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, ok, ok. How did this happen to me? How did this happen to me? A week ago, two weeks ago, I was fine. Ross was just Ross, just this guy. Now he’s Rrrooossss, oh, this really great guy that I can’t have.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sweetie, I wanted you to have him too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know you did. I’m just gonna deal with it, I’m just gonna deal with it. (Ross comes by, smoching with Julie on the phone.) I gotta get out of here. (Exits)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, I don’t care what you guys say, something’s bothering her.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know, I think I was sixteen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please, just a little bit off the back.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m still on “no.”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, morning. Do you guys think you could close your eyes for just a sec?
content.parenthetical: poking her head in from her bedroom

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no-no, (grabs his pants) I’m not fallin’ for that again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I sorta did a stupid thing last night.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What stupid thing did you do?

content.speaker: Paulo
content.text: Bon giorno tutti!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ewww! (Gets up and walks away.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, Paulo, why don’t you just go get dressed, and then you be on your way, ok, bye-bye. (Paulo goes into his room.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, how did this happen?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, I just kinda ran into him last night.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: At his apartment. Is this juice?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, whoa. And the fact that you dumped him because he hit on Phoebe?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, I know I’m a pathetic loser.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, you’re not pathetic, you’re sad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: People do stupid things when they’re upset.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My god, if I had a nickel for every guy I wish I hadn’t…(Everyone looks at her), but this is about your horrible mistake.
(Ross and Julie enter.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. Sorry we’re late but we were—well, there was touching.

content.speaker: Paulo
content.text: Hey, hey Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Paulo. What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Paulo
content.text: I do Raquel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, uh, he’s back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, he’s back. Is that a problem?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, not a problem.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good! I’m glad it’s not a problem.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, you’re gonna have to not touch my ass.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, in spite of the yummy bagels and palpable tension, I’ve got pants that need to be altered.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Chandler, when you see Frankie, tell him Joey Tribbiani says hello. He’ll know what it means.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you sure he’s gonna be able to crack that code?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know it’s funny, the last time Paulo was here, my hair was so much shorter and cuter.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. Ok, but, but! You have to promise that you will not be all like control-y and bossy and Monica about it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I promise.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. (Talking to Monica’s hair.) Now some of you are gonna get cut, and some of you aren’t. But I promise none of you are gonna feel a thing.

content.description: Monica’s bedroom, Phoebe is finishing with her haircut and Monica is whincing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, that’s it, I quit.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? I didn’t say anything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but this (makes Monica’s face) isn’t the face of a person who trusts a person. Ok, this (makes Monica’s face) is the face of a person who, you know, doesn’t trust a person.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m sorry, Phoebe. It’s just a little shorter than what we had discussed.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Would you relax? I know what I am doing. This is how he wears it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How who wears it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Demi Moore.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Demi Moore is not a he.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he was a he in Arthur , and in Ten .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s Dudley Moore. I said I wanted it like Demi Moore.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Oh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! I’m sorry, I’m sorry. Which one’s Demi Moore?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s the act ress that was in Disclosure , Indecent Proposal , Ghost !

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, she’s got gorgeous hair.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know !

content.description: Frank’s tailor shop, Chandler is getting his pants measured.

content.speaker: Frankie
content.text: How long do you want the cuffs?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: At least as long as I have the pants.
(Pause as Frankie resumes his work.)

content.speaker: Frankie
content.text: I just got that. Ok, now we’ll do your inseam.
(He slowly measures it up his leg, and Chandler makes a rather surprised face.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is recovering from her haircut, Phoebe is playing her doctor and is coming in from the bedroom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How is she?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s too soon to tell. She’s resting, which is a good sign.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How’s the hair?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m not gonna lie to you, Ross, it doesn’t look good. I put a clip on one side, which seems to have stopped the curling.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can we see her?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Your hair looks too good, I think it would upset her. Ross, why don’t you come on in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. (Gets up, but then pauses when he realizes what that meant.)
(They go into the bedroom leaving Joey and Rachel alone.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How’re you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, that bad, huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I can sense when women are depressed and vulnerable. It’s one of my gifts.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: When I saw him get off that plane with her, I really thought I hit rock bottom. But today, it’s like there’s rock bottom, 50 feet of crap, then me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You gotta tell Ross how you feel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on. How can I just tell him? What about Julie?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What about her? They’ve only been going out for two weeks. Ross has been in love with you for like 10 years.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, Rach, Rach! I’ve been with my share of women. In fact, I’ve been with like a lot of people’s share of women. The point is, I’ve never felt about anyone the way Ross felt about you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yo, paisan! Can I talk to you for a sec? (Pause) Your tailor is a very bad man!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Frankie? What’re you talking about?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what’s goin’ on? (Pats Chandler on the shoulder which causes him to jump.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey’s tailor…took advantage of me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No way. I’ve been going to the guy for 12 years.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on! He said he was going to do my inseam, and he ran his hand up my leg, and then, there was definite…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Cupping.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s how they do pants! First they go up one side, they move it over, then they go up the other side, they move it back, and then they do the rear. (Chandler and Ross stare at him) What? Ross, Ross, would you tell him? Isn’t that how they measure pants?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes it is. In prison! Whatsa matter with you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? That’s not? (Realizes) Oh my God.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, later that day. Monica is now out and about.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Even Mary Tyler Moore would’ve been better.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I like it. I do, I think it’s a Ten. (Chandler laughs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. My hair is very amused.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, Monica, things could be worse. You could get caught between the moon and New York City. I know it’s crazy, but it’s true.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I gotta go. Bye. Bye, Rach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait, are you leaving?
content.parenthetical: sticking her head in from the balcony

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, that’s kinda what I meant by “bye!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, can I talk to you for a sec?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (goes out onto the balcony)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, when the doctor does that hernia test…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s ok.
[Out on the balcony]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, first of all, Paulo and I are not back together. It was just a stupid thing I did, and if I could go back in time and do it again, well, I wouldn’t. Um, second of all (Ross is laughing), what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok. Well, before I say anything, I just need to know, is this one of those things where you break up with a guy, and then I tell you what I think, and then the next day you get back together with the guy, and I look like a complete idiot?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. No-no-no-no.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, then, I think, I think the guy is scum. I hate him. I mean I actually—I-I physically hate him. I always have. You are way too good to be with a guy like that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You deserve to be with someone who appreciates you, and who gets how funny and sweet and amazing, and adorable, and sexy you are, you know? Someone who wakes up every morning thinking “Oh my god, I’m with Rachel”. You know, someone who makes you feel good, the way I am with Julie. (Rachel has moved closer, but hearing that she starts to back up.) Was there a second of all?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I think that was the whole all.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Okay. (They hug.) Okay.
[Cut back inside, Joey is on the phone.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I swear to god, Dad. That’s not how they measure pants.

content.description: Central Perk, Julie is wanting to get her hair cut from Phoebe.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: I was thinking of doing it a little shorter, you know, like Andie McDowell’s new haircut?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah! Oh, I can do that.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You wanna do it right now?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Great! (Julie leaves)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, I just wanna be really sure this time. Andie McDowell’s the girl from Four Weddings and a Funeral , right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. No no no no no. That’s Rodney McDowell. Andie McDowell is the guy from Planet of the Apes .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah. Ok, thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re welcome.
